resources.string: [w] Lehetséges, hogy az időzóna nem megfelelő ehhez a helyhez.
[w] A dátum a mai naptól eltérő napra van beállítva.

{0} after {1, plural, one {{2, select, female {} other {}}} other {{2, select, female {} other {}}}}{3}

Mutassa minden időnél a másodperceket is.
A dátumok megjelenítésekor mutassa az időt is.
A hónapok rövidített neveinek megjelenítése a dátumok megjelenítésekor.
A 7 napnál hosszabb időintervallumok hetekre osztása (pl. 15 nap lesz 2 hét 1 nap).
Mutassa az órákat és a perceket egy napnál hosszabb időintervallumoknál.
Egy objektum által vetett árnyékok hosszának megjelenítése %1$s magassággal.
Harmadik féltől származó bővítmények keresése és letöltése.
Elrendezés cseréje a rendelkezésre álló hely kitöltéséhez

A név mező nem lehet üres.
Ez az azonosító már foglalt. Ez a művelet felül lesz írva.
Biztos hogy visszaállítod a műveleteket alapértelmezettre?\n\nMinden egyéni művelet törlésre kerül.
Az azonosítónak egyedinek kell lennie (már foglalt).
A név mező nem lehet üres.
Biztos benne hogy törli a(z) %1$s témát?
Az esemény mutatva lesz az alkalmazásban.
Az esemény nem lesz mutatva az alkalmazásban.

Biztos benne, hogy törölni szeretné a(z) %1$s (%2$s) eseményt?\n\nElőfordulhat, hogy az eseményt használó riasztások, értesítések vagy modulok már nem fognak működni, ezért újból hozzá kell adni őket.
Biztos benne, hogy törölni szeretné az egyéni eseményeket?\n\nElőfordulhat, hogy az eseményt használó riasztások, értesítések vagy modulok már nem fognak működni, ezért újból hozzá kell adni őket.

Support: visit the issue tracker to submit a request.

Source Code:
Copyright © 2014-2023 Forrest Guice
Source code available under GPLv3.
Az első indítási konfigurációs varázsló indítása.

Swap layouts to fill available space

[enabled] The widget will switch between layouts depending on available space.

[disabled] The widget maintains its initial layout when resized. Use this with the \"scale text and icons\" option for extra large widgets.
This widget was created with a %1$s initial layout.

The following title substitutions are supported:

All Widgets:
* %d for date (e.g. February 12)
* %dd for day (short) (e.g. Mon)
* %dD for day (long) (e.g. Monday)
* %dY for year (e.g. 2018)
* %dt for time (of last update)
* %dT for time with seconds (of last update)

* %loc for label (e.g. Budapest)
* %lat for latitude
* %lon for longitude
* %lel for elevation (e.g. 225 meters)

* %s for data source (e.g. sunrisesunsetlib)
* %t for time zone (id) (e.g. Europe/Budapest)
* %id for appWidgetID

Sun Widgets:
* %m for mode (short) (e.g. Civil)
* %M for mode (long) (e.g. Civil Twilight)
* %o for order (e.g. Last/Next, Today)

Moon Widgets:
* %i for moon illumination (e.g. 25%)
* %M for moon phase (e.g. Waxing Crescent)
* %o for order (e.g. Last/Next, Today)

Solstice Widgets:
* %m for mode (short) (e.g. Solstice)
* %M for mode (long) (e.g. Winter Solstice)
* %o for order (e.g. Closest Event, Upcoming Event)

Date Format: A date format pattern.

Available elements may differ between calendars, but usually include..

E : day of week
d : day of month
D : day of year
F : weekday in month
M : month of year
y : year of era
G : era

[Icon Rising] moonrise 		[Icon Noon] lunar noon 
[Icon Setting] moonset 		[Icon Midnight] lunar midnight 

Share [Icon Share] will copy text to the clipboard.

Spring Cross-Quarter: The midpoint between Winter Solstice and Spring Equinox; February [northern hemisphere], or August [southern hemisphere].

Summer Cross-Quarter: The midpoint between Spring Equinox and Summer Solstice; May [northern hemisphere], or November [southern hemisphere].

Autumn Cross-Quarter: The midpoint between Summer Solstice and Autumnal Equinox; August [northern hemisphere], or February [southern hemisphere].

Winter Cross-Quarter: The midpoint between Autumnal Equinox and Winter Solstice; November [northern hemisphere], or May [southern hemisphere].

[Icon OK] Choose a custom event.
 [Icon Add] Add, [Icon Edit] edit, or [Icon Delete] delete custom events.
 
Custom events can be displayed by the app, by home screen widgets, or used to schedule alarms and notifications.
 [Icon View] Marked events are displayed by the app.

[Icon Back] to cancel without making changes.
[Icon Save] to save, and [Icon Done] to save and enable.
[Icon Cancel] to save and disable.
[Icon Delete] to cancel and delete.

[Icon Offset] is shown when the scheduled time is offset before or after the event time.
Day Light Saving: [Icon DST] is shown when the current time applies DST, or has been adjusted by a similar rule.
Actual Time: The sun is on the horizon; this is the approximate time of sunrise and sunset.

Civil Twilight: The sun is 6 degrees below the horizon; the brightest stars are visible. There is enough light for most outdoor activities without requiring a light.

Nautical Twilight: The sun is 12 degrees below the horizon; object outlines and the horizon are increasingly indistinct. There isn\'t enough light for most outdoor activities without requiring a light.

Astronomical Twilight: The sun is 18 degrees below the horizon. Near darkness of night.

Today: Rising and setting event times for today\'s date.

Last / Next: The time of the last event, and the next upcoming event.

Spring Equinox: The start of astronomical spring; March [northern hemisphere], or September [southern hemisphere]. The March equinox is also called the northward equinox.

Summer Solstice: The start of astronomical summer; June [northern hemisphere], or December [southern hemisphere]. The June solstice is also called the northern solstice.

Autumn Equinox: The start of astronomical autumn; September [northern hemisphere], or March [southern hemisphere]. The September equinox is also called the southward equinox.

Winter Solstice: The start of astronomical winter; December [northern hemisphere], or June [southern hemisphere]. The December solstice is also called the southern solstice.

Tropical Year: A full cycle of the seasons. The length of the tropical year is measured from one March equinox to the next. It is ~365.24 days on average, with an exact length that varies each year (up to 30 minutes).

Length of day: the amount of time between sunrise and sunset.

Usable light: the amount of time between morning and evening civil twilight.

Moon Illumination: The moon widgets and main page display the moon\'s illumination at lunar noon (the midpoint between moonrise and moonset), while the moon dialog displays the moon\'s current illumination.

Golden Hour: The sun is between 6 degrees above or below the horizon. In the morning the golden hour begins with civil twilight and ends a short time after sunrise. In the evening the golden hour begins a short time before sunset and ends with civil twilight.
Blue Hour: The sun is between 8 degrees and 4 degrees below the horizon. The start and end of the blue hour falls between nautical and civil twilight.

To add a new widget you must navigate to the home screen.

To reconfigure an existing widget you can select from the following list.

[Icon Add] Add a new theme or [Icon Copy] copy from an existing theme.
 
 [Icon Edit] Edit or [Icon Delete] delete themes.
 The [Icon Default] default themes cannot be modified.

Supply events to the Calendar app (moon phases, solstices, and equinoxes).

Calendar integration was removed in v0.10.0.

This feature is now available as a separate app.

Privacy:
Suntimes does not collect, store, or transmit personal user data. It contains no advertising, no analytics, no trackers, and no unnecessary permissions.

Privacy:
Suntimes does not collect, store, or transmit personal user data. It contains no advertising, no analytics, no trackers, and no unnecessary permissions.

The app is configured from location data. This information (and other configuration data used by the app) is stored locally and does not leave the device.

%1$s

Suntimes uses the location permission to determine your current longitude and latitude.

This permission is optional; the location is manually configured by default.
Suntimes uses external storage permissions to backup/export data to file (e.g. places, themes).

Suntimes Alarms uses the external storage permission to play sounds located on the SD card.

This permission is optional; the default sound will be played if access is denied. This permission is not needed for system sounds (Media Storage).

A permission that belongs to Suntimes:

%1$s

is also defined by: %2$s
This feature is not supported by API %1$s.
This feature is not supported by the current data source.
A reboot may be needed for changes to take effect.
A restart may be needed for changes to take full effect.
Do not show this message again
A simple, relatively fast, but imprecise calculator.
Follows algorithms published by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.
Follows algorithms published by Dershowitz/Reingold in their book "Calendrical Calculations" (third edition).
Based on astronomical calculations published by Jean Meeus in his book "Astronomical Algorithms" (second edition).

Suntimes uses third-party libraries to perform astronomical calculations.

The data source setting allows choosing between different libraries (or choosing between different algorithms offered by those libraries). The default is time4a-time4j.

This setting affects the speed and accuracy of calculations, and may limit which features are available.

For more information about available choices, or extending the app to support other libraries, see the online help.
